shapes3d.utils
Class Bezier

java.lang.Object
  shapes3d.utils.Bezier

public class Bezier
extends java.lang.Object

This class is used to represent a single Bezier curve of degree >= 2 in either 2D space.
Note the degree of a Bezier curve equals the number of control points.
Its primary purpose is to act as a convenience class to maintain a collection bezier controls points.
In this library the Bezier object is used by the BezierShape class to create a 3D shape by rotating it about the Y axis [0,1,0]. Degree Shape
2 straight line
3 quadratic bezier
4 cubic bezier
and so on

Author:
Peter Lager

Bezier

public Bezier(float[][] points,
              int nbrPoints)
Create a Bezier object based on points passed as a 2D array.

Parameters:
points - 2D array[point no.][x/y]
nbrPoints - number of points to use from array

Bezier

public Bezier(processing.core.PVector[] points,
              int nbrPoints)
Create a Bezier object based on an array of vectors.
The bezier curve will use all of the points in the array.

Parameters:
points - array of control points
Method Detail

insertPoints

public void insertPoints(float[][] pts,
                         int nbrPts,
                         int pos)
Insert a number of points into the bezier curve.

Parameters:
pts - a 2D array of point i.e. [x][y]
nbrPts - the number of points to insert
pos - the position to insert (<=0 before first point; >= degree after last point)

pos - the position to insert (<=0 before first point; >= degree after last point)

insertPoints

public void insertPoints(processing.core.PVector[] points,
                         int nbrPts,
                         int pos)
Insert a number of points into the bezier curve. Although using PVector only the x,y values of the vector are used.

Parameters:
points - an array of PVector's
nbrPts - the number of points to insert
pos - the position to insert (<=0 before first point; >= degree after last point)

removePoints

public boolean removePoints(int first,
                            int last)
Remove control points from first to last inclusive.
Silently fails if first or last are outside array bounds or last < first or if it means the number of points left would be < 2

Parameters:
first - the first point to be removed
last - the last point to be removed
Returns:
true if points are successfully removed

removePoint

public boolean removePoint(int point)
Removes a single control point
Silently fails if point is outside array bounds or if it would leave less than 2 control points.

Parameters:
point -
Returns:
true if point successfully removed
